1.content:
"Oh great! Another day with this gifted class!" Audrey was about to reach the building where she teaches human development classes. Her job is to help people reach their full potential physically and mentally, mostly broken people that doesn't know how to bounce back in life. She give them relaxations classes, yoga classes, teach them how to be healthier and to push them to the extrem to meet their limit and in the end fullfil their expectations.
Until that day, she had absolutely no problem with her clients, she always found a way to show them their true self, but their last class was the exception.
Not that the cases were different or harder than usual, but the clients made absolutely no effort to change the way they were.
From the lazy slob that is always an hour late, excused himself a thousand times, promesses to change à million times, but keep acting the same because "that' s how he always was, and you can't change someone in two weeks. " Or the unemployed mother that is so afraid to leave her children home that she can't even try to make an effort to change her lifestyle. Or a stubborn girl, that everybody encourages to lose weight because her health is at stake but she can't seem to care about it and always talk about body positivity.
Audrey is always on the verge depression when she finish her day with them, hopefully she got her sport classes to take out all that frustration out of her body and mind.
"I don't know how much I can take anymore?" she think to herself before entering the classroom. "This time, I'll go hard on them, that's not the best solution, but it seems like the only solution. Desperate mesure for desperate time...".
She takes a deep breath and push the door, entering the room with a firm step.
1.title: Hard Times

The room is another square soulless classroom with little grey tables and grey chairs.
No signs of originality or special by the architect, just a, room in a million in a building in a million.
"Hello everyone, how is... Everyone ? Or more like, where is everyone? Lola do you know where they all are?!
- I don't senora! But maybe Johnny will arrive later, as always.
- What a bunch of ungrateful jerks! They got the luck of getting someone to help them in their life, and they dare to do this? What is wrong with them?
- I don't know, maybe they got tired of certain someone, always telling them what to do and how to do it?" Audrey arrives at her desk and get choked by what the massive girl just told her.
Lola was a big girl, she would describe herself as a beautiful and bonified woman, a B. B. W., she already had a lot of health problem due to her 600 lbs frame, but she never saw it as a problem in itself. "These people are just jealous that I'm happy with my body the way it is. They never knew the benefits of body-positivity." she always said, while grinning in the face of her disbeliefed teacher.
"What did you just say?
- I say that it bother us that always think that you're better than us?
- I never said that I was better than you, I was brought here to help with your problems and...
- I don't have any problems, said Lola cutting Audrey in her diatrib.
- Lola, let's be clear, you do have a problem, and that's not because you turned your changed your former teacher's mind about weight that it'll stop you from getting heart attacks and blood pressure problems. You have a...
- I wouldn 't say it if I were you!
- Don' t ever cut me off again! Alright! I'm your teacher, I'm here to help, you have to show me the respect that I deserve. Your medics told me about your problems.
- Last time!
- Lola, you have a weight problem! You are morbidly obese, and it won't get better with time. You have to do something with your weight. "
As Audrey finish her sentence, Lola looks at her with wide eyes as if it could shoot lightning to her teacher.
" You dare call the O word, you dare say that I have a weight problem.... You have absolutely no idea what you've just stepped into. I tried to prevent from saying but you didn't listen to me. Now you gonna have to pay the price...
